page.title: 01THE MENDIPS
page.content: This part of the Mendips is an area of intensively managed farmland with a patchwork quilt of fields. The valleys are sites for many villages and hamlets containing many old stone built houses and cottages. Dairy farming predominates, though farmers on the higher ground in particular, also keep sheep. The dairy farmers manage their grassland intensively, producing silage, hay and grazing. An increasing number of fields are being used to produce grains, following the new milk quota regulations of 1984. Architecturally, there are many fine buildings, not least the churches in this area. Older buildings have been constructed with a variety of local stones which blend into the landscape. Mendip dry stone walls are a feature unique to this area.
